title: How to Make Patriotic Strawberries

steps.headline: Rinse the strawberries.
steps.description: Gently handle the strawberries under running water, rinsing off any dirt attached to them. Pat dry with paper towels.

steps.headline: Melt the white chocolate with the vegetable oil.
steps.description: Create a double boiler or melt the chips in a microwave-safe bowl, stirring occasionally until melted thoroughly.

steps.headline: Dip the strawberries.
Harden the strawberries.
steps.description: Arrange them on a wax paper lined baking sheet. Allow the chocolate to harden; usually 15 minutes. You could also harden and store these in the refrigerator.

text:
Rinse the strawberries. Gently handle the strawberries under running water, rinsing off any dirt attached to them. Pat dry with paper towels. Melt the white chocolate with the vegetable oil. Create a double boiler or melt the chips in a microwave-safe bowl, stirring occasionally until melted thoroughly. Dip the strawberries. Hold the strawberries by the hull or top to avoid messes. Carefully dip about 1/2 to 3/4 of them into the melted chocolate. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":322,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":531.3736263736264,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Dip about half of the chocolate dipped strawberry into the edible glitter or sugar. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Patriotic-Strawberries-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":309,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":510.4945054945055,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Harden the strawberries. Arrange them on a wax paper lined baking sheet. Allow the chocolate to harden; usually 15 minutes. You could also harden and store these in the refrigerator.
